newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real closes steady in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real closes steady in quiet trade.

text.p: Brazil's real closed flat at 1.0346 against the dollar in calm trading on the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
In the afternoon, the Central Bank bought dollars at 1.0345 reais per greenback to drain excess dollars from the market.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Tuesday surplus of $200 million.
Despite the large surplus in net dollar flows, dealers were concerned with the low level of contracted exports. Monday's surplus was due to financial buys, which reached $460 million, they added.
Dealers are expecting a new drop in the real-dollar mini-band in coming days, believing the Central Bank hopes to make the exchange rate more attractive for Brazilian exports.
The current mini-band was set last Thursday between 1.0345 and 1.0395 reais per dollar.
In the interbank forex floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0403 to the dollar, down 0.01 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 0.18 percent to end at 1.100 per greenback.
